CN.content:
Please identify the "Material Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Both the hole mobilities and PCEs are among the highest values in the current reported devices fabricated from naphthodithiophenebased copolymers.

Let's think step by step.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material name" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Material Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Material Name |
| --- |
| naphthodithiophene-based copolymers |

The other term "hole mobilities" and the acronym "PCEs" are related to properties or characteristics of materials, not the materials themselves. Therefore, they are not considered as "Material Name" entities.

PN.content:
Please identify the "Property Name" entities in the following paragraph. Please present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name". Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

Paragraph: Both the hole mobilities and PCEs are among the highest values in the current reported devices fabricated from naphthodithiophenebased copolymers.

Let's think step by step.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| hole mobilities |
| PCEs |

The two "Property Name" entities in the paragraph are "hole mobilities" and "PCEs" (which stands for power conversion efficiencies). These terms refer to properties of the devices mentioned in the paragraph.

Please remove entities that do not clearly refer to "Material property" and present the valid entities as a Markdown table with one column "Property Name".

Make sure to present the entities precisely in the same words as in the original paragraph.

| Property Name |
| --- |
| hole mobilities |
| PCEs |

In this paragraph, both "hole mobilities" and "PCEs" (which stands for power conversion efficiencies) are clear examples of material properties. I have removed any entities that do not refer to material properties, and the resulting table contains only these two terms.
